'''Chippewa Valley Schools''' is a school district located in [[Macomb County, Michigan|Macomb County]], [[Michigan]]. It contains twelve [[Primary education|Elementary]], four [[Middle school|Middle]], and three [[High school|High Schools]], with a total enrollment of over 16,000 students<ref>{{cite web|title=About Us|accessdate=2011-12-2|url=http://www.chippewavalleyschools.org/about.asp}}</ref>. It is the second largest school district in Macomb County and the ninth largest in the state of Michigan.
==High schools== ===Chippewa Valley High School=== {{Infobox school |name = Chippewa Valley High School |image = <!-- Missing image removed: [[Image:Cvhs.jpg]] --> |motto = HOME OF THE BIG REDS |established = 1961 |type = Public |head = Dr. Jerry Davisson |city = [[Clinton Township, Macomb County, Michigan|Clinton Township]] |state = Michigan |country = USA |coordinates = {{Coord|42.612335|-82.938156|region:US|display=inline}} |campus = Suburb |students = 2200+ |faculty = |free_label = |free = |colors = Red,White,Black(alternative) {{color box|red}} {{color box|white}} {{color box|black}} |mascot = Big Reds |feeders = [[Chippewa Valley Schools#Algonquin Middle School|Algonquin]], [[Chippewa Valley Schools#Iroquois Middle School|Iroquois]], [[Chippewa Valley Schools#Wyandot Middle School|Wyandot]]|homepage = http://www.cvs.k12.mi.us/cvhs/ }} Chippewa Valley High School is a public high school located in [[Clinton Township, Macomb County, Michigan|Clinton Township]], Michigan. The school is one of three high schools in the district. Starting with the 2008-2009 school year, Chippewa Valley High School opened its Ninth Grade Center. The current principal of the Ninth Grade Center is Diane Zatkoff, and Jerry Davison is the current principle of Chippewa Valley High School.

===Dakota High School=== {{Infobox school |name = Dakota High School |image = |motto = HOME OF THE COUGARS |established = 1995 |type = Public |head = Tom Heethuis |city = [[Macomb Township, Michigan|Macomb Township]] |state = Michigan |country = USA |coordinates = {{Coord|42.644726|-82.909599|region:US|display=inline}} |campus = Suburb |students = 2,512+ |free_label = |free = |colors = Green,Navy,Gray {{color box|green}} {{color box|Navy}} {{color box|gray}} |mascot = Cougars |feeders = [[Chippewa Valley Schools#Iroquois Middle School|Iroquois]], [[Chippewa Valley Schools#Seneca Middle School|Seneca]], [[Chippewa Valley Schools#Wyandot Middle School|Wyandot]] |homepage = http://www.cvs.k12.mi.us/dakota/ }} Dakota High School is a public high school located in [[Macomb Township, Michigan|Macomb]], Michigan, United States. It opened in 1995 as the second high school in the Chippewa Valley school district. An overflow of freshmen caused the need to build a ninth grade center. However, as that building could not be built in time for the 2007-2008 school year, Dakota had to utilize a finished wing of the new Seneca Middle School building. The Ninth Grade Center has been open and in use since the 2008-2009 school year. This school is full of nasty hos.

==Middle schools== ===Algonquin Middle School=== Algonquin Middle School is found in [[Clinton Township, Macomb County, Michigan|Clinton Township]], Michigan. Their mascot name is the Eagles.
{{Infobox school |name = Algonquin Middle School |image = |motto = '''Home of the Eagles''' |established = 1968 |type = Public |head = Walt Kozlowski |city = [[Clinton Township, Macomb County, Michigan|Clinton Township]] |state = Michigan |country = USA |coordinates = {{Coord|42.571754|-82.922684|region:US|display=inline}} |campus = Suburb |students = |colors = Red and Gold {{color box|red}} {{color box|gold}} |mascot = Eagles |homepage = http://www.cvs.k12.mi.us/algonquin/ }}
===Iroquois Middle School=== {{Infobox school |name = Iroquois Middle School |image = [[Image:Chippewa Valley Schools logo.png]] |established = Sept. 1981 |type = Public |head = [[James Capoferi]] |city = [[Macomb Township, Michigan|Macomb Township]] |state = Michigan |country = US |coordinates = {{Coord|42.652374|-82.939209|region:US|display=inline}} |campus = Suburb |students = 970+ |colors = Green & White {{colorbox|green}} {{colorbox|white}} |homepage = http://www.cvs.k12.mi.us/iroquois/ }} Iroquois Middle School is one of four middle schools in the Chippewa Valley School District located in Macomb County, Michigan.
Previously the Iroquois Indians, the mascot was changed to the Panthers due to inappropriate nature of referring to American natives as "Indians". It was also agreed that "Panthers" sounded like a tougher name for its teams.
In April 2008, the school started construction to add a new wing to the school, a new band room, and several other rooms. The construction is now completed and the classrooms are now in use.
===Seneca Middle School=== {{Infobox school |name = Seneca Middle School |image = |established =2007 |type = Public |head = Todd Distelrath |city = [[Macomb Township, Michigan|Macomb Township]] |state = Michigan |country = USA |coordinates = {{Coord|42.611607|-82.933998|region:US|display=inline}} |campus = Suburb |students = 1900+ |colors = Gold, Green, and Black |homepage = http://www.cvs.k12.mi.us/seneca/ }} Seneca Middle School is a suburb based campus previously located in [[Clinton Township, Macomb County, Michigan|Clinton Township]]. While that building is now used as the Chippewa Valley High School 9th Grade Center and the [[International Academy of Macomb]], the new building opened for the 2008-'09 school year is located in [[Macomb Township, Michigan|Macomb Township]] next to Dakota High School and Cheyenne Elementary School. Their mascot is the "Jaguars," and the school colors are green, gold, and white. Seneca Middle School is located on Heydenreich and 21 Mile Road. The principal is Mr. Todd Disteralth, and the assistant principal is Mr. Jeff Nelson.
===Wyandot Middle School=== School located on Garfield Rd. in [[Clinton Township, Macomb County, Michigan|Clinton Township]] Michigan.
